sentences: Kogu kulusid oli miljonite kroonide vahemikus.
context: The word 'miljonit' is the partitive case form of 'miljon' (million) in Estonian. The partitive case is used to indicate an unspecified or partial quantity, often with numbers like 'one', 'two', etc., or when talking about money, large quantities, or uncountable items. In this context, 'miljonit' means 'millions' and would be used when referring to a quantity of millions (of something) in the partitive case.
